newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Lion sees "satisfactory" 97/98 shr growth.
newsitem.headline: Lion sees "satisfactory" 97/98 shr growth.

text.p: South African match firm, The Lion Match Co Ltd, said on Monday it expected to achieve a "satisfactory" improvement in earnings in its new financial year.

It said in a statement accompanying annual results that despite inflationary pressure and continuing high levels of unemployment, a stable domestic match market, supported by modest increases in private consumption expenditure, was expected.

"This, together with further progress in exports and the normalisation of production at the Durban match factory, should enable a satisfactory increase in earnings to be achieved in the forthcoming year," the group said.
Lion earlier posted an increase in year attributable earnings to 92.4 cents a share from 80.1 cents a year ago.
It declared a total dividend of 38.0 cents compared with 33.0 last year.
